prompt:
Implement Sprint 1 of the Todo App.

## Project
Full-stack todo application.
- Backend: Go + Gin + GORM + SQLite in the `backend/` directory
- Frontend: React + TypeScript + Vite + Tailwind CSS in the `frontend/` directory
- Working directory is the current directory.

## Stories to Implement

### US-01 — Go Backend Scaffold
- `go run ./...` from `backend/` starts server on port 8080
- `GET /health` returns 200 with {"status":"ok"}
- First run auto-creates todos.db via GORM auto-migrate
- Every request logs method, path, status code, latency to stdout

### US-02 — React + TypeScript Frontend Scaffold
- Vite + React + TypeScript in `frontend/`
- Tailwind CSS configured
- `npm run dev` starts on http://localhost:3000
- Browser shows "Todo App" title
- `npm run build` succeeds with no TypeScript errors

### US-03 — Create a Todo
- Backend: POST /todos — 201 Created with todo object; 400 if title empty
- Frontend: Enter key submits; empty input ignored; input clears after submit

### US-04 — List All Todos
- Backend: GET /todos — returns all todos as JSON array
- Frontend: fetches on mount; shows loading indicator; empty state message; each todo shows title + checkbox

### US-05 — Complete / Uncomplete a Todo
- Backend: PUT /todos/:id — toggle completed; 404 if not found
- Frontend: checkbox toggles; completed = strikethrough; persists on reload

### US-06 — Edit a Todo Title
- Backend: PUT /todos/:id updates title
- Frontend: double-click enters edit mode; Enter/blur saves; Escape cancels; empty title cancels

### US-07 — Delete a Todo
- Backend: DELETE /todos/:id — 204 No Content; 404 if not found
- Frontend: delete button visible on hover only; removal is immediate

### US-08 — Filter Todos by Status
- Frontend footer: All / Active / Completed filter buttons
- Active = incomplete todos; Completed = done todos; active filter highlighted

### US-11 — Loading & Error States
- Skeleton loader while fetching
- Toast notification on API error; auto-dismisses after 4 seconds
- Action buttons disabled while request in-flight

## Technical Rules
- Go: CORS must allow requests from http://localhost:3000
- TypeScript: no `any` types without justification
- All config (ports, DB path) via environment variables with sensible defaults
- No hardcoded URLs in frontend — use relative paths via Vite proxy

## Definition of Done
- `go build ./...` succeeds (run from backend/)
- `go vet ./...` passes (run from backend/)
- `go test ./...` passes (run from backend/)
- `npm run build` succeeds (run from frontend/)
- All acceptance criteria above are satisfied

When ALL acceptance criteria are implemented and ALL builds pass, output:
<promise>COMPLETE</promise>
